body.p: The template.XULElem("notificationbox") element is used to display notifications above an element. Typically the element will be a browser, but any element may be used. The template.XULElem("notification") element is used for each notification, and will be created automatically for each item. Each notification will slide in and out as needed. This element is used, for example, to implement the yellow information bar in various Firefox windows.

The notification box is a vertical box which may have children. The notifications appear at the top of the box. The notifications may be placed at the bottom by setting the template.XULAttr("dir") attribute to reverse.
Within a Firefox extension, you can retrieve the current notification box for a specific tab by calling the global function getNotificationBox():
body.pre: notifyBox = chromeWin.getNotificationBox(notifyWindow) notifyBox = getNotificationBox(notifyWindow) // applies to current context's window object
body.p: Here, chromeWin is the XUL window (usually just window), and notifyWindow is the web content window for the tab you want to find the notification box for.
